thread.title: How WWII generals used camouflage to foil air attack | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: How WWII generals used camouflage to foil air attack | Daily Mail Online

author: Darren Boyle For Mailonline
title: How WWII generals used camouflage to foil air attack | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad America's undercover war: Rare photographs show how entire factories and bases were hidden with camouflage netting to throw the enemy off the scent in the wake of Pearl Harbor US generals were afraid during the early months of 1942 that Japanese bombers might strike the West Coast Large factories vital to the nation's war effort and near the coast were covered with special camouflage nets The US Air Force then flew over the camouflage areas to photograph the nets to test their effectiveness Two Japanese submarines were spotted off the coast which fueled speculation about a potential attack
